snippet: The sole survivor of Israel’s founding generation in public office, Shimon Peres stretched the bounds of a largely ceremonial office.
abstract: Israeli Pres Shimon Peres, at age 90, will be the world's oldest head of state for six more weeks before he leaves the presidency, but he refuses to retire from public life; he aspires to be a global matchmaker between technology companies and problems like poverty and disease; Peres has over the last seven years reinvented presidency and has become Israel's most popular public figure and a world-stage statesman.
lead_paragraph: The sole survivor of Israel’s founding generation in public office, Shimon Peres stretched the bounds of a largely ceremonial office.

headline.main: Peres, at 90, Is Ready to Leave the Israeli Presidency, but Not to Retire
headline.print_headline: Peres, at 90, Is Ready to Leave the Israeli Presidency, but Not to Retire
